text:
PresetTimeCallback vs ContinousCallback
which one should I use if I want to have callbacks at preset times but I desire high accuracy of the callback execution. I know that PresetTimeCallback <: DiscreteCallback so perhaps there is no rootfinding, is it true? My question what is the fundamental difference between PresetTimeCallback and ContinousCallback for event time accuracy.

elements.text:
PresetTimeCallback vs ContinousCallback
which one should I use if I want to have callbacks at preset times but I desire high accuracy of the callback execution. I know that PresetTimeCallback <: DiscreteCallback so perhaps there is no rootfinding, is it true? My question what is the fundamental difference between PresetTimeCallback and ContinousCallback for event time accuracy.

text: I have suspicion that PresetTimeCallback might be better overall as itegrator can step at the exact time point I need. But it's subtype of DiscreteCallback which is not accurate (in execution time)

text: discrete callbacks will always have perfect accuracy. Use them when you can

text: Yes, there is no rootfinding in the PresetTimeCallback
